resources.string: Discover the beauty of the city of 100 towers and magical athmosphere. Every place can give you a key for a secret cipher.
The trip starts at Prague cultural, social and commercial center.
Visit: National Museum, St. Wenceslas Statue, Lucerna Palace.
Key: What are the names of Czech patrons on the St. Wenceslas Statue?
From the bottom part of Wenceslas Square go down through the street Na Můstku to the next point.
Visit: Old-town town-hall, Astronomical Clock, Church of Our Lady before Týn, St. Nicholas\' Church, Kinský Palace, Jan Hus Memorial.
Key: How often can you see apostles in the windows of the Astronomical Clock?
From the Astronomical Clock go to the Malé náměstí and then through the Karlova street and follow the directions to the next point.
The second oldest bridge in the Czech Republic from 1357. The most known among 30 Prague bridges with 30 amazing statues.
Visit: Old Town Bridge Tower, Lesser Town Bridge Towers and take a look at bridge statues.
Key: How many pillars does Charles Bridge have?
On the right side you can see the next point - Prague Castle. Follow the directiones to the next point.
The biggest old castle in the world with area of 7.28 ha, where the president resides.
Visit: St. Vitus Cathedral, Old Royal Palace, Golden Lane, Powder Tower, gardens and changing of the Castle Guards every hour.
Key: The construction of St. Vitus Cathedral started in 1344. When was it finished?
Return to Charles Bridge and go down to the Kampa Island.
Prague Venice, the second most beautiful city island of the world.
Visit: Čertovka (Devil\'s Channel), Werich Villa, Sova\'s Mills (Museum Kampa), Babies.
Key: After which famous person is named a wall near to the Kampa Island?
"At the end of the island go to Legie Bride to the last point. "
Our journey ends across from the National Theater in the well-known café, which will give you the last key to the cipher.
Visit: Have a cup of great coffee with strudel and from a window you can remember the beautiful places you have visited.
Key: Which famous people have visited Slavia Café?
THANK YOU, that you went with us to discover these beautiful places in the heart of Europe - magical Prague.
All answers have to be answered correctly.

resources.string: the secret cipher is the VLTAVA and that is why our journey finishes right here.

The VLTAVA, with its length of 430.2 km, is the longest river in the Czech Republic. Can you remember from how many Prague bridges you can admire its beauty? If you like more, you can see Prague from steamboats or you can hire a small boat around Charles Bridge.
